title: What is the likelihood of the existence of a modern pagan initiation tradition in the West?
first_phrase: In the previous text, the author discusses the distinction between not knowing if something exists and knowing it cannot exist. The current text examines the challenges of identifying a potentially hidden esoteric tradition, specifically a modern and pagan one, in the West. The author observes that the deep and ongoing hostility towards paganism has made it difficult for such a tradition to exist openly. The author argues that this pervasive antipagan sentiment presents a challenging condition for any pagan initiatic center to emerge and thrive.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the deep-rooted animosity of the dominant religion in the West against paganism is still present today, making it difficult for a pagan initiation center to thrive. However, the existence and work of various pagan initiates in the last glorious centuries of the pagan world, such as Apollonio, Plotino, Massimo, and Giuliano, serve as strong evidence that pagan initiation centers did exist during the imperial Roman era.
